pr_title: bumping up version for beta.2 release and adding changelog

timeline.message: bumping up version for beta.2 release and adding changelog

timeline.bodyText: We can be a little more detailed in the changelog. Usually where we want to be succinct is in the release notes. If this is all there is then that's cool though :)
timeline.author: vcolin7
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,13 @@
+# Release History
+
+## 1.0.0-beta.3 (Unreleased)
+
+## 1.0.0-beta.2 (2020-10-05)
+
+### New Features
+
+- Added pagination support.

replies.bodyText: I don't know if we have someone coordinating publishing the release notes or all other related stuff for mobile. //cc @czubair.
replies.author: vcolin7

replies.bodyText: @bsiegel I believe the docs are still like last time for mobile, i.e. it goes to https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk-for-android/. Please confirm
replies.author: anuchandy

replies.bodyText: And mobile android/iOS is yet to be onboarded to https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk/releases/latest/index.html. This means, there is no change in process since the last beta.1 release.
replies.author: anuchandy

replies.bodyText: Confirmed the doc publishing to github.io is still manual
replies.author: bsiegel

replies.bodyText:
To close on this:

JavaDoc will go to GitHub pages.
The onboarding of mobile to the wider Azure SDK release page can be a follow-up PR to the here.
replies.author: anuchandy

timeline.bodyText: Is this the only place we should update the version number?
timeline.author: vcolin7
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,6 +1,6 @@
 ext.publishName = "Microsoft Azure Android Core Library"
 description = "This package contains core types for Azure Android clients."
-version = "1.0.0-beta.1"
+version = "1.0.0-beta.2"

replies.bodyText: Yes, this is the only place.
replies.author: anuchandy

timeline.message: updating READMEs and expanding on changelog entry
